website_summaries.verdict: This durable and strong carving knife is an excellent value for its price.
pros: Serrated blade swiftly cuts cheese, meat, and bread
cons: A variable speed feature would have been appreciated

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible. Nearly impossible to operate because of the "safety" ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. Nearly impossible to operate because of the "safety" button. It's positioned on the trigger, and you can't operate it with one hand. The button is spring-loaded and does not stay in--as soon as you release the trigger, it locks. You have to press the button with your other hand which is dangerous! Ridiculous design. There is so much side-to-side wobble in the blades (and yes, they're properly connected and inserted) that you can't even cut crusty bread. I have a 30+ year old Kenmore electric knife that I will keep using. This is the worst product I have ever purchased, and I've purchased a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lindybell

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use, Easy To Clean-Fantastic Electric Knife
customer_reviews.text: This Electric Knife was reviewed at American Test Kitchen as the best. We decided to buy it. The price was excellent. This was very easy to use and extremely easy to clean. There is a button to lock it for safety. The on button is very easy to press with one's thumb. We carved a turkey and were extremely impressed about how well it worked to carve the turkey. We wish that we had bought this last Thanksgiving. We had it for this year's Thanksgiving and it did an excellent job. Plus the price was only $19.99 and it arrived a day early via our Prime Membership. We suggest that anyone who needs an electric knife try this one.
customer_reviews.author: JosyMaude

customer_reviews.title: which cut the steak like butter. The motor seems good but the blades ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black and decker to replace a cuisinart electric knife (just need to replace the brushes which are $12) since it is quite a bit cheaper and thought it would do the same thing. However, the knife doesn't cut very well and was barely able to cut a flat iron steak without helping it along. I soon gave up and went with a regular knife, which cut the steak like butter. The motor seems good but the blades are much duller compared to the cuisinart blades. I guess I'll be buying the brushes for the cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: BByronB

customer_reviews.title: Purchased April 10 - No longer works August 16
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked well. The blade could have cut better, but it did the job and I could get consistent slices. I went to use it last night and it no longer works. I tried a different socket with the same result. It's broken. Should have spent more on a better model that would have probably lasted more than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Low dollar, high value, mainly because it works!
customer_reviews.text: I got this knife for $13 and so far, it has performed admirably. It makes carving turkey, roast beef, ham, etc very easy. Much easier to get consistent thicknesses and no tearing. The blade is small enough that it can get into smaller pockets on a turkey. I do wish the "case" for the blades that was included was hard plastic, as the soft plastic one will get chewed up pretty quick, but what I really wanted was a low dollar solution, and this certainly was! I'll update if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the fact that you must push and hold the ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the fact that you must push and hold the button in in order for it to work. It may be a safety feature but for those of us who have the use of one hand it makes it impossible to work so I gave it to my daughter. My daughter has the use of both hands and said she found it awkward and difficult to operate. I would not recommend this knife to anyone/
customer_reviews.author: alice arredondo

customer_reviews.title: High priced junk
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for about a month and just got around to using it. I turned it on and it cut fine for maybe 15 seconds and then the blades quit reciprocating. Amazon said my "window"to return it has expired. Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: crudfoot

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Item was easy to assemble, use and clean. Purchased one for Thanksgiving last year and it made carving the turkey a simple and enjoyable undertaking. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I finally received the product I purchased but unfortunately it did not last. I didn’t need to use it right away but tested it and it ran. When it came time to actually do work with it, it failed miserably. What a shame the name is not what it use to be. Passed the return period so it found itself in the trash. I will never buy this brand in anything again.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny M

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to handle, doesn't cut well, shakes when you use it. Its late to return, I should have tried it right away. Not sharp enough, cant cut through the crust, you have to use extra strength which causes wrist pain and blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Sevul'

customer_reviews.title: Lasted three years, cut well first year, died last night
customer_reviews.text: I used this knife to cut open cell foam for equipment cases, usually no more than 3-4 inches of foam. It cut quick and easily the first year. The next year one of the blades seemed to be stuck but it could still cut. Last night the motor seized. I got perhaps three dozen uses out of it in all. I expected better from B&D. Trying the Cuisinart knife next.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend for bread makers
customer_reviews.text: I'm very unhappy with this purchase and am afraid I won't be able to return because I've used it and not kept the packaging. I bought this to replace my dull bread knife. I make bread all the time and always cut it with a regular knife and just thought this would make my life easier. It's WAY harder to cut bread with this than a regular knife. I have to saw to get through the crust (and my bread is not THAT crusty) at the top and bottom, and my hand is aching after cutting a loaf while holding the button. If you're thinking about this for bread, I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Not great for upholstery foam.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on Upholstery foam for a Cosplay project. I don't highly recommend this product for this use, it didn't clean cut through the foam like ive seen other electric knives do. I used fabric sheers more to shape the toes, if you are looking to use this knife for this kind of use id suggest paying a little more. I gave 4 stars because it's not technically designed for this use and can't say how it works for it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: I've used electric knives for 40 years so I'm not new to them. This knife is horrible! The blades constantly come apart while carving and that makes it dangerous. After using it maybe ten times I threw it right in the garbage. It isn't worth the frustration or the danger of falling knife blades. I'm surprised that an electric knife could be this bad. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for price.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic "2 blade" carving knife. The stainless blades are longer than most competitors at 9". Excellent for large birds and roasts w/o being awkward or heavy. Is rather light too. As far as sound goes, much quieter than a much more expensive, but more elaborate, elec knife. Only thing I wish it had or was different is I think it could of came with at least a storage bag. Because there is no case and no way to keep blades and body nicely together in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Easing carving for arthritic hands....
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this knife to my mother, who has severe hand arthritis. She's been having a hard time carving up meat for years, and was too stubborn to try the electric knife. This holiday meals were easy to carve up. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Easiest, Most Efficient Knife I’ve  Owned
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this knife after our original (circa 1974, harvest gold) finally bit the dust. It cut through our Christmas ham like a dream. It’s easy to assemble and disassemble. Hands down then best electric knife to be ever used. The bonus is that it’s an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Strand

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use; Worked Well for My Project
customer_reviews.text: I used this knife to cut out foam in a rifle case. I read a few reviews complaining about the safety button and how hard it was to depress the button. I had no such issue. I pushed the safety button to the side (did not pull out as one review suggested) and away I went with cutting. I used the knife turning it in multiple directions to make my cuts without issue. Worked for me and I recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Cuts  homemade bread perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to insert the blades this was super easy to use. It’s not complicated, it just took some maneuvering the first time, and ever since then I can assemble it quickly. I use it every time I make fresh bread. It helps make my slices thinner and more even, so the loaf lasts longer. And now my slices aren’t mangled like they were when using a standard bread knife.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a bread machine and discovered that cutting fresh baked bread is no easy task. Taking to the handy dandy internet for clues, I stumbled upon this wonderful product. This electric knife does the job quickly and easily, with easy setup and cleanup. The blades connect together to make them easier to handle and snap into the base securely. The locking feature is fantastic to have in a house with three kids in it. The blades are easy to remove for cleanup and have held up well to multiple runs through the dishwasher. I would highly recommend this to anyone because it's simply a wonderful item. I look forward to trying this on more items in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha Locy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the new Black and Decker knife
customer_reviews.text: Was not pleased with my new Black&Decker knife. I use the knife for cutting and shaping medium density foam. I have had it for almost 10 years. I purchased this new one because my old Black&Decker was getting dull. I liked the old one a lot, so I ordered the same one. The new one does not cut. The old one cuts better. I swapped knives and motors with both the new and the old. The old knife motor with old blade was the best, the old knife motor with new blade came in second, and the new blade and new knife motor was clearly the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Hermione Granger

customer_reviews.title: Great foam cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an electric knife to cut upholstery foam and did not want to pay the price for dedicated units that cost ten times more. It cut through 6" thick foam though not as quickly as a professional unit. By holding the handle vertically, it can easily follow a pattern and make a smooth cut. Since the blade is rounded on the end, you don't have to worry about the surface under the foam.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Cuts meat cubes like butter
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad because he likes to buy giant tough cuts of meat. He’s very clumsy in his old age so watching him try to cut little pieces with a giant knife made me nervous and Initially when this arrived I thought I had made it worse and essentially bought him a cooking chainsaw. But once he started using it I saw it did help. It doesn’t vibrate too much and is very maneuverable so he doesn’t have to use as much force as before and the rounded end prevents him from poking himself. I now have peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Thatgirlyoumetonce

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to other reviewers - Died after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Bought in November, dead in Febuary after only 4 uses. Motor spins, but blades do not move. I should have paid more attention to the reviews here. I had the same experience as many others with 1 star reviews. Look at all the reviews that highlight that symptom and realize you will be buying into a major design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Cut through foam padding like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make cutting 2 inch foam easier. I reupholstered 8 chairs and the first pad I tried to cut with scissors - it was pretty jagged. With the electric knife I was able to make a smooth continuous cut. This knife worked great. I did have a problem with the safety button when first starting. It was a little stiff and took two hands - 1 to push the button in and hold it until I could use the other hand to push the trigger past the button. I'm sure it was just my weak hands. After starting it a couple of times I only needed one hand to operate the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Rita H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this knife
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Black and Decker electric knife my we used for around 20 years. So with that in mind we purchased this one. My wife loves the easy assembly and cleaning. I sliced a Prime Rib roast like it was hot butter. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: graywolf201

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This knife cuts everything like if it was butter. It's easy to use and very easy to clean. It's a product that you must have in the kitchen. However, I wish it had a better way to store the blades. Overall, it's made with an excellent quality and it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Monica B.

customer_reviews.title: Got this knife to slice bread. Held it again ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this knife to slice bread. Held it again a freshly baked crusty rustic loaf for 20 seconds and it couldn't even break the surface of the crust until I press it down so hard to the point it was crushing the bread. Had to slice the bread manually with my regular knife. Needless to say I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to cut foam for gun/camera cases
customer_reviews.text: I got a pelican case to store and transport a nice firearm and learned that one of the best ways to make a form in the foam for the gun was to cut it out with an electric carving knife. Unfortunately my wife did not have one that I could "borrow" but this was not terribly expensive and to save myself the trouble of trying more intensive methods I bought this product and it worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Biesemier

customer_reviews.title: Love it ! I should buy it early
customer_reviews.text: During SIP I bake everything and cook everything by myself! This electric knife is good for me to cut bread and toast!!!! Easy and safe to use
customer_reviews.author: Tabby

customer_reviews.title: It's a good size for his large hands (not too small of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my dad to replace the one from the 70's that he was using that died. He cuts foam with it to store his collectors trains and cars for protection and shipping. It's a good size for his large hands (not too small of a grip/handle) and it's light weight. Sharp blade and cuts through stuff like butter. Does the job. Only thing about it is it doesn't come with a case or bag for storage like some other more expensive models did. But for what he's using it for I guess it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This knife SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this item 0 stars I would. Worst electronic knife EVER! Never made it through the first slice of our turkey & stopped working completely. Because it was to long since I bought it before we used it, can’t return it. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela morgan

customer_reviews.title: Search no more this one works
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever electric knife. I’ve seen them in action but I’ve never used one before. I bought this one and it makes cutting barbecued meat easy to cut. It cuts through tri-tips and ribs with ease. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Lozano

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I order this Black & Decker electric knife and this is the second knife I am returning. The first knife sent to me had paperwork in the box indicating it was a defective product. I have boxed it for return via UPS. The second one just arrived and all I have is the knife but no blade. Not sure what kind of quality service you are providing but I expected a new working condition electric knife with all the parts in a new box. I have requested a return on my money and will purchase from a knife from someone else. Pretty poor service for someone who uses Amazon extensively. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bero

customer_reviews.title: Ackward to hold and cut
customer_reviews.text: I have had an electric knife for many years. One of the blades were lost so I had to buy a new one. I don't use it often so the price was great on this one. This one is not comfortable to hold. It is difficult to squeeze the trigger while cutting. Sometimes the button to unlock the trigger is hard to push. I looked at it and thought maybe I mistakenly got a Black & Decker knock off. But no, it just was not comfortable to use. I am not sure I would buy Black & Decker again. I know it will not be this model.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta J. Fahr

customer_reviews.title: Best in Show.
customer_reviews.text: This knife was on PBS . They were tested against 10 knives. It was best in cutting bread , meat, and foam. This knife came out the winner. I purchased it as a very early birthday gift. I will post more in December. Thank you Amazon for the quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used this to carve several turkeys and a ham and it's easy to use and makes both thin and thick cuts ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a black and decker we had had for 20+ years. I was a little concerned with some of the reviews but my experience has been positive. I've used this to carve several turkeys and a ham and it's easy to use and makes both thin and thick cuts with ease. I would recommend this to a friend or consider this as a gift to give.
customer_reviews.author: Odie1Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: My old electric knife was much better. (Was also same brand, thought it was same model and it maybe but like everything, newer ones are not made as well. Feels very cheap and doesn't slice all that well. Feels like you are fighting the knife and trying to hack instead of it gliding.
customer_reviews.author: heidi turgeon

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: First time using it to carve a small turkey and it had a electrical burning smell.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Walser

customer_reviews.title: Decent knife at the price point
customer_reviews.text: -I'm updating my review from 2 stars to 4 stars because the 2 year warranty of the product worked and I now have a replacement that works great. Did not last very long but it did a great job while it was working. One of the blade keeps slipping out making it very frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Duckˑ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I used this knife to cut up a foam mattress which had a defect in it. It would have cost me over $150 to have a mover take the mattress away. I was able to cut it up and put it in a dumpster for free except for the cost of the knife. The knife was surprisingly easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Saw it in action works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my step daughter and her husband after last Christmas. This Christmas I got to see it in action. Works well... comfortable, and did the job. They use it all the time on a roast or a need to cut evenly into slices food. I think I may buy one for me as a spare. I have the one I bought so many years ago and it still cuts great. Amazon continues to offer many very good products at reasonable prices. If you want to carve or slice, but don't want the struggle... then buy a electric knife like this one and make your neighbors jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Lover of old movies

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this knife. I have owned it since April 2015, but only used it twice. Once at Thanksgiving 2015, and tried to use it at Christmas. It has plastic gears and in two uses, was useless. At Christmas, we were busy, so I just put it away and used a knife, and forgot about it until I needed to cut a pork loin yesterday. Nope...won't even cut a stick of butter. It is cheap, but it is built very cheaply and not even worth the low price. Never again a Black and Decker electric knife for me.
customer_reviews.author: Coburncorner

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised and pleased about the quality and the safety of his electric knife. I had had an old knife from 30 years ago and it was no longer working well .. I purchased another brand locally and it was horrible. So when I ordered this one I hoped that I would be able to use it to on breads with thick crusts. I have been using it to cut mellons,etc I have arthritic hands and they are no longer strong. So this knife is a huge help
customer_reviews.author: docgold

customer_reviews.title: More Uses than the Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to cut foam based on a suggestion from youtube. It worked beautifully for what I needed and was well priced. Do not know how it works in the kitchen but may find out one day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: but I'd like to think slicing meat is not as hard as ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought it to cut foam for a window pad. It worked really well at first and gradually got duller/junked with the foam material. I was using it not as intended, but I'd like to think slicing meat is not as hard as cutting through foam? The two knives liked to separate from each other during use sometimes. It worked for what I was doing, but I think I'm going to need to recycle it now.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie11

customer_reviews.title: Good value- does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Thanksgiving turkey carving and it did a decent job. Not quite as powerful as I’d hoped-not sure how it’ll work on something like beef but for poultry was great. Easy clean up and easy to store which was a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: CT Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No match for my turkey and ham
customer_reviews.text: Burned up the old knife ..needed new ..bought this one based on reviews. Compared to my worn out knife this cuts like butter. It's a bit on the long side so need to get used to it but not a bad knife for the price point
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for your Thanksgiving bird!
customer_reviews.text: Made quick work of my Thanksgiving turkey! You will never use a regular carving knife again. Also great for prime rib, pork loins, and even slicing cakes.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Never had an electric knife before, and very happy with purchase. Use on artisan bread, poultry, ham, roast, etc. Lightweight and easy to transport with sleeve for blades. Intuitive, so no need to read instructions unless you want to. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lee

customer_reviews.title: BEST ELECTRIC KNIFE—EVER
customer_reviews.text: Bought in time to use for Thanksgiving. Don’t know how we managed without this B&D electric knife! Easy to assemble, use, clean, and store. Great price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie A.

customer_reviews.title: Love the electric knife!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was kind of concerned about the safety switch, but they must have fixed it because there is no problem with it now. You click it off and turn it on and it runs, you let go of it, clic it on, it runs. It doesn't automatically lock the safety switch. I am thoroughly happy with the electric knife.
customer_reviews.author: BlackHillsDave

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought One Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted an electric knife for years. Hubby gave me money for Christmas and decided to finally buy one. Pleasantly surprised - not as expensive as I expected and reviews led me to this one. I love it! Easy to use, carves well, easy to clean, doesn't take a lot of room to store. I might make this a wedding gift for friends and relatives. Every kitchen should have one
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Leiphart

customer_reviews.title: Great knife works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to BBQ and smoke meat but cutting up all the meat when he is done can take time when just using a regualr knife, So he mentioned getting a electric knife but did not want to spend a ton of money on one. When I see this knife and the price was right and had great reviews I knew this was the one we needed. He used this knife over the weekend after smoking some ribs and a brisket and it worked perfectly. The knife cute thru the meat effortlessly. I highly recommend to anyone who needs an electric knife.
customer_reviews.author: amy34

customer_reviews.title: Great knife.
customer_reviews.text: We love to use this electric knife for cutting meats and Breads. My wife bakes a couple of batches of bread each week (4 loaves at a time) and this knife makes cutting that bread quicker and much easier. Great investment! The blades are sharp and the knife has been trouble free for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cut the matterss nicely. Was making new sofa cushions out of a nemory foam twin mattress
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Really good knife
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife. I have had a stroke and my right hand is a bit weak and stiff. This makes an electric knife my fav tool. I do find the handle awkward to hold but more my hand than the knife. It is fairly light to use and cuts fast through warm meat. Overall the price is right for me and a good knife.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen N. House

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: This one is so easy to handle with the squeeze trigger on the bottom. I had one with a button on top and it was awful. I am very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for cutting foam
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for cutting foam for car seats. Works great. Who knows might use it on meat someday too
customer_reviews.author: rdct

customer_reviews.title: Works on foam
customer_reviews.text: I am cutting firm 6” firm foam for cushions, it works great. The trick is to cut at a 45 degree angle and apply slight pressure and go slow.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Z

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for cutting foam
customer_reviews.text: Used this for cutting memory foam and cushion foam. This cuts through those like crazy easy! HOWEVER the trigger lock is a PITA. It's difficult to activate and makes me want to remove it. But it's a safety feature, so uh... don't want to remove it. So the trigger is quite annoying to use. Once you get it going though it's awesome. The blades are REALLY sharp already, and then it's electric! I'm going to try and get a second set of blades so I can use it on the Thanksgiving turkey! hah. Overall satisfied, but the trigger safety design sucks!
customer_reviews.author: czk_2000

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend !
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! Very easy to remove blades to clean. Was very impressed with how it operated when slicing our Christmas ham.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: A need to
customer_reviews.text: I got this electric knife to cut my veggies. My finger are not what they use to. It is easy to handle, sharp blades cut like butter, and quick. I glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Nerry Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Delivers as promised
customer_reviews.text: After looking at similar products 3-4 times the cost I ended up purchasing this electric carving knife. We received the product quickly with no problems or packaging damage. I opened the knife that evening and used it on a couple large beef tri tips. Cut through the meat like "butter" in record time. Clean up was a breeze with the knifes easily detaching from the mechanical side and separating into 2 seperate pieces (dishwasher safe too). The knife also comes with safety locking system to stop the little ones from grabbing it and accidently turning it on. All-in-all....great knife and looking forward to using it on other cuts of meat and bread!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rands

customer_reviews.title: Garbage pail junk
customer_reviews.text: Garbage!! Got half way through a roast with first use and then the blades quit moving. Too bad B&D didn't have a refund policy longer
customer_reviews.author: Fab Books

customer_reviews.title: Works good.  Oddly off-set blades.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good knife but the offset blades create a torque-ing action which is unnecessary and not in-line with the stroke of the blades.
customer_reviews.author: G. Or J. Horn added

customer_reviews.title: Purchasing This Knife is Not Worth Your Time and Money
customer_reviews.text: Really poor knife with blades are very difficult to control. Don't waste your money on this product. I tried to carve a turkey when I had friends over for dinner, and I ended up using my Chicago Cutlery instead. I am very disappointed in this knife.
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like buttah
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut upholstery foam. It went through two inch foam like butter. Couldn't be happier with this electric knife's performance.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Works well on foam and probably on bread and meat as well.
customer_reviews.text: Actually we bought his electric knife to cut foam which it does quite well. Haven't tried it on meat or bread but I expect it would perform equally well.
customer_reviews.author: KBM

customer_reviews.title: Good! but...
customer_reviews.text: Great item. My mom had one, and when I moved out and got married I wanted to get one as well. The only difference I noticed is that there is a safety pin that needs to be pushed in when using. I found this annoying and took some pliers to remove it. Took about a minute and it works great. I don't have any kids yet, and I don't leave it plugged in so I am not afraid of accidentally sawing a finger off. As far as cutting, I only use it for bread, and it works great. We go through bread quickly so this makes it nice instead of having to saw at it with a bread knife.
customer_reviews.author: ESwan

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great electric knife with decently long blades. Very easy to hold and maneuver through the meat. Used on a ham and a Prime Rib so far. Worked perfectly on both.
customer_reviews.author: Ktat5

customer_reviews.title: Not so sharp
customer_reviews.text: I’m using it to cut foam and cardboard for packing art. I regret not getting one with a pointy tip. This blade filled after about a year. My peers have had theirs last longer
customer_reviews.author: luttine

customer_reviews.title: Good try though
customer_reviews.text: One Star Awkward. The design is not user friendly. It's similar in operation as...trying to get a child proof lighter to work with one hand. The safety switch must be squeezed in one direction while you're simultaneously squeezing the blade trigger....making one handed continuous operation impossible.It locks up again any time you let go of the trigger. Good try though.
customer_reviews.author: Sopo Baker

customer_reviews.title: An Artists’ tool as well as a chefs’!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cut foam to make costume heads. It works perfect! And if it can design animal heads for me imagine how easy it is to carve your holiday turkey!
customer_reviews.author: Xsvblonde

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive knife!
customer_reviews.text: I wished I could give 10 stars. I was concerned because this was a "cheap" knife. I have used it approximately 15 times for different things, ham, turkey, brisket, bread, just to name a few. It works consistently and I've never had an issue with it. It stores easily and the entire knife cleans spotless after every single use. I wished the cord was a bit longer, but I can get over that! I absolutely recommend this to any level of Chef/Cook! It is so easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorinda Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Love it 😍
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of being able to cut meet a certain size or sandwich or for dinner. The fact that you can stop and start is great the blades are very good quality I mean it’s a Black & Decker!
customer_reviews.author: carole ann mcgoldrick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and $
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese garbage. Don’t waste your money. Not clear how this has positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: illya

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color, died after 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a black one, received a white. Died after a couple uses. Banged it with my hand and it came back on. Died a couple minutes later. Sounds like a return got mixed up. Maybe a short in wire. Last one I had I used a lot for a couple of years. $#!+ happens.
customer_reviews.author: NGM

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Love it. Simple to use and used it on a whole Ham. Did the job. No problems. Can’t live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jadelin Abreu

customer_reviews.title: slices and dices
customer_reviews.text: Works good the trigger is a little too strong to hold in for a lone I guess I'm getting to old cuts well
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl V. Zeller

customer_reviews.title: My go-to knife for carving turkey!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to assist me in carving the Thanksgiving turkey and works better than I could have imagined. It made carving a snap after watching a couple of YouTube videos on carving. The most helpful one was the Alton Brown video carving a turkey with an electric knife such as this Black & Decker. My only wish was that it was cordless. Maybe next time.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon.com buyer

customer_reviews.title: Superb for cutting styrofoam
customer_reviews.text: The safety button remains off when pressed. Superb knife for cutting styrofoam. Very thin slices are easy —- as are subtle changes of shape.
customer_reviews.author: Majoch

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife but a bit short for bread
customer_reviews.text: Decent knife. So far I just use it to cut fresh bread. Works fine. Just barely long enough for my loafs.
customer_reviews.author: opel02

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned an electric knife and had no idea what I was missing till now. I have used this on Turkey and ham and it has performed fantastically! So sharp and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: Used this for installing fiberglass insulation.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for installing fiberglass insulation. Cuts fiberglass batt like a hot knife through butter!
customer_reviews.author: hummvee69

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cutting Foam Rubber
customer_reviews.text: It's an electric knife. I have had many over the years, and this one performs as expected; it's a keeper. Most of the negative reviews I read seem to be from people that simple did not know what to expect from an electric knife. It might take a lil' getting used to. Have patience; let the knife do the work... remember not to force it. There's nothing better for cutting foam, and rubber straight and smooth... And yes, tomatoes too.
customer_reviews.author: Dal

customer_reviews.title: It cut thru the matters topper like a hot knife thru butter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric carving knife for the purpose of cutting a memory foam mattress topper into smaller sections to fit into dog beds. It cut thru the matters topper like a hot knife thru butter. Not sure how it works on meat.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Pickle

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a baguette
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cut through the crust of a baguette well. Maybe it needs to be sharper for such a task.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I use it for cutting the bread I make. Good price for the job. Safety feature is simple and effective.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken how to fix myself
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a rattle inside. Although it eorker ok it made a very loud noise. I disassembled reglued the part causing the problem now it works okay. Just unlucky I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Nash.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use it!
customer_reviews.text: The designof this knife leaves much to be desired. I could not get the safety latch to operate properly, so I called Black and Decker Customer Service, hoping to get some help. However, the representataive told me that the design had been changed, which made operating it difficult, but there was nothing to be done to help. She seemed familiar with the issue so I assume I was not the first one to call for assistance. At this price, I don't want to go to the expense or trouble of returning it, but I certainly would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B. Roehmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting large piece of pork into chop size servings. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Kypriss

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's an "ok" electric knife. My real complaint is how lose and flexible the blades are. Even when cutting through something like crispy bread the blade will flex and bend and it's difficult to get consistant strait cuts and even more so when slicing up a thick cut of beef.
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Mazur

customer_reviews.title: Great electric knife
customer_reviews.text: Don't use it terribly often, but every time I do, I remember what a great deal I got! I usually use it to cut a big tri-tip or sirloin steak and it ALWAYS gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Am quite satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Ordering and delivery was, as usual "Amazon" perfect. It was in new condition and has worked perfectly, but have to admit that I bought it to cut foam rubber and it has performed flawlessly doing so. Bet it will work on butter, also.
customer_reviews.author: ets

customer_reviews.title: They don't make 'em like they used to!
customer_reviews.text: This is an example of the above statement. My last electric knife lasted for 30+ years. If this one makes it to one, I'll be surprised. It is loud and requires pressure to cut even a loaf of bread.
customer_reviews.author: bpbikergirl

customer_reviews.title: Pop and arc
customer_reviews.text: It fit the hand well and carved well but when you trigger it it would pop and you could see an arc from the trigger area. I haven't been shocked but there is something definitely wrong with the electrical. I'm not going to bother returning it. for the money I paid, the aggravation isn't worth it. When I purchase another one I'll spend more money and get one with a longer blade.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dacey

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for Thanksgiving and made cutting easier according to my boyfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. I know it sounds weird, but I use it to cut upholstery foam. Cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife to replace my old, similar one that died. I use it exclusively to slice bread that I bake, and it does this job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Sir B

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 9-Inch Electric Carving Knife, Black,
product_meta.description: Color:BlackSlicing is simple with the BLACK+DECKER 9-Inch Electric Carving Knife. From carving meat, to slicing bread, to cutting foam for craft projects—this knife makes quick work of it all. The 9-inch stainless steel blades snap securely into place and an intuitive trigger turns the knife on and off. Wrist fatigue is minimized thanks to the Comfort Grip handle, which features a comfortable, ergonomic design. Plus, cleanup is a breeze—just hit the blade release button and lay the blades flat on the top rack of your dishwasher. They’ll be ready to go for your next project.
feature_bullets: Comfort Grip Handle - The ergonomic handle gives added control during slicing
Safety Lock Button - Prevents the knife from turning on while it's plugged in
Blade Release Button - Unlocks the blades for easy removal

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,429 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
